author: Patrick Sloan-Turner
title: VISD school board candidate called antisemitic for social media post | News | victoriaadvocate.com
text: A social media post from January by a candidate for the Victoria Independent School District‚Äôs board of trustees has been called blatant ‚Äúantisemitism‚Äù by a leader in Victoria‚Äôs Jewish community. In a post on Jan. 25, Andrew Rokovich, of Victoria, shared a video to his Facebook page with a caption suggesting people of the Jewish faith have acted immorally for 2,000 years. A video attached to the Facebook post explains Jewish practices related to eruv. An eruv is a symbolic boundary in Jewish law that allows carrying objects in public spaces on the Sabbath within that boundary. Above the video reads ‚ÄúThey have been allowed to morally skirt laws for 2000 years, seems like a coincidence?‚Äù ‚ÄúThis is just blatant, unapologetic antisemitism,‚Äù said Dr. Gary Branfman, a local surgeon and member of Victoria‚Äôs Temple B‚ÄôNai Israel about the post. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hate ... Anybody who stereotypes us as if we represent one group is absurd.‚Äù Rokovich, 40, is running to represent the Victoria school district‚Äôs District 2 on the school board. He is the former president of the Victoria Young Republicans Club. On Wednesday, he said he did not remember writing the post but ‚Äúthat doesn‚Äôt mean I didn‚Äôt.‚Äù ‚ÄúI can say I don‚Äôt don‚Äôt disagree with the sentiment. I‚Äôm a Catholic,‚Äù Rokovich said. When asked if he respects other religions, Rokovich said he took issue with the question, saying ‚Äúrespect, No. 1, is earned, and it‚Äôs not earned because of your religion.‚Äù During a phone interview Wednesday, Rokovich acknowledged the page was his. As of Wednesday, [the page](https://www.facebook.com/people/Andrew-Rokovich/100007516338724/?paipv=0&eav=Afb_GfEsBIatbTD3Q-KeeEsXgOhZ2of8j8Y2-gk0sdDqpAvsyhA3AQ1Wcj3XR8s8CW0&_rdr) was publicly viewable. ‚ÄúAnd, also, for the record, I will not be going on the Facebook and deleting anything,‚Äù Rokovich said in the interview. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt believe in that garbage. Everything‚Äôs there.‚Äù On Thursday, the page could not be viewed by the Victoria Advocate‚Äôs Facebook profile. ‚ÄúWhen this happens, it‚Äôs usually because the owner only shared it with a small group of people, changed who can see it or it‚Äôs been deleted,‚Äù according to Facebook. Branfman was quick to remind of the dangers of antisemitism, especially during heightened conflict in Gaza. Locally, Branfman said Victoria has seen examples of antisemitism ‚Äî a swastika was spray-painted on the B‚ÄôNai Israel temple along with the words ‚Äúthe Jews.‚Äù As someone of the Jewish faith, Branfman said speech like the kind of speech in Rokovich‚Äôs post is always deeply dangerous, but definitely so from someone running for public office. ‚ÄúThe danger is somebody getting into office and promoting this blatant antisemitism to young people who don‚Äôt know better. That‚Äôs the danger,‚Äù Branfman said. ‚ÄúThe danger is that lies get magnified. And when there‚Äôs no opposition to them, there‚Äôs no alternative viewpoint. People then take this kind of antisemitism to be true.‚Äù Rokovich said he is not antisemitic and this matter or his personal views about the Jewish faith don‚Äôt relate to his candidacy for the school board. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt equate to us being in debt and spending our last dollar anywhere, and that is completely separate from Israel,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe real message I want (voters) to understand ... Is VISD is in dire need of administration changes ... And that‚Äôs really what I‚Äôm going to put my energy and focus into.‚Äù ‚ÄúA big part of my campaign is including everyone, regardless of whether I agree with them,‚Äù said Rokovich, adding Branfman had contacted him to share his thoughts about Rokovich‚Äôs post. For Branfman, hate speech is normalized when an elected official with antisemitic views feels fine sharing them publicly. Before some realize it, people who hate those of Jewish faith are in positions of high power, he said. ‚ÄúEighty-five years ago in the 1930s, 25,000 Nazis had a rally at Madison Square Garden in New York City. Everybody said, ‚ÄòOh, it‚Äôs gonna go away,‚Äô‚Äù Branfman said. ‚ÄúIt starts small. They get elected to school boards and then to city government and then the state government. It starts with this whole concept, right? And then from there, it‚Äôs a snowball rolling down a hill.‚Äù

text:
Um adolescente de 14 anos levou descarga el√©trica ao encostar em um poste no bairro Douradinho, em S√£o Carlos (SP). O menino e outros garotos estavam jogando bola na quadra de areia, na Pra√ßa Ondina Caporaso, quando o acidente aconteceu.
O jovem escalou o alambrado para pular para o lado de fora. Quando segurou no alto do poste, ele tomou o choque.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Washington County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Washington County, Pennsylvania from 1901-2000 was 31.4. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Washington County, Pennsylvania experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Washington County, Pennsylvania history.

author: SueAnn Howell
title: Adoration Sodality Beckons at Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament in Alabama
text: More than 3,000 members from all 50 United States and 27 countries are currently enrolled in Eucharistic prayer association. HANCEVILLE, Ala. ‚Äî As the Catholic Church in the United States prepares to cap off the National Eucharistic Revival with the National Eucharistic Congress July 17-21 in Indianapolis, the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament and its Adoration Sodality beckon to all who desire to deepen their relationship with Jesus Christ. The Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament, celebrating its 25th anniversary, is fueled by the prayers of the Poor Clares of Perpetual Adoration, an order of cloistered Franciscan nuns who live in the adjoining Our Lady of the Angels Monastery. The Adoration Sodality , a worldwide prayer apostolate begun by the Poor Clares, is now in its second year. A Glorious Temple for the Lord Situated on 400 acres in northern Alabama, the Shrine of the Most Blessed Sacrament is a testimony to faith in divine Providence of the late Mother Mary Angelica, foundress of the Our Lady of the Angels Monastery and the Eternal Word Television Network. She began a quest to find land for a new monastery in 1995, after the activity and growth of the global network centered around her monastery in Birmingham made solitude challenging for the nuns. She envisioned moving to a small farm for their life of prayer before the Blessed Sacrament. The Divine Child Jesus had other plans, which he divulged to her on her trip to South America in June of 1996 to publicize EWTN‚Äôs new Spanish channel. She visited the shrine dedicated to the Divino Ni√±o, the (‚ÄúDivine Child‚Äù), in Colombia. While praying before this statue of the Holy Infant, it appeared to move. ‚ÄúAll of a sudden, He turns to me,‚Äù Mother Angelica related, ‚Äúand He says, ‚ÄòBuild me a temple and I will help those who help you.‚Äô‚Äù Dedicated in December 1999, the shrine and the monastery are inspired by the great Franciscan churches and monasteries of the 13th century. The monastery was built for durability and simple monastic living. The shrine, with imported materials from around the world, including a 7-foot monstrance housing the Blessed Sacrament above the main altar, was designed to be as beautiful as possible, befitting the infinite dignity of God, whose house it is. Today, tens of thousands of visitors make a pilgrimage to the shrine, seeking to deepen their relationship with Jesus Christ during their time of spiritual refreshment. Uniting Souls Worldwide The Adoration Sodality, begun in March 2023, is open to all who believe in the True Presence of Jesus Christ in the Most Blessed Sacrament. More than 3,000 members from all 50 United States and 27 countries are currently enrolled in the Adoration Sodality. Members promise to make a Holy Hour in front of the Blessed Sacrament at least once a month and recite the ‚ÄúI Adore Thee‚Äù prayer they receive upon enrollment when in adoration. Sodality members share in the spiritual benefits of a monthly sodality Mass, during the day of recollection led by a guest Eucharistic Preacher every third Thursday of the month during ‚ÄúAdoration Sodality Days‚Äù at the shrine. They also share spiritually in the daily ‚ÄúNovena to Our Lady of Good Remedy,‚Äù and in the prayers and good works of the Poor Clares of Perpetual Adoration offered at the shrine. ‚ÄúBelonging to the Sodality is a real, spiritual connection with us and with brothers and sisters in Christ around the world who are committing themselves to adoration,‚Äù Mother Mary Paschal, abbess of Our Lady of the Angels Monastery, told the Register. ‚ÄúThis Sodality serves as an aid to put Christ first in our lives, to return his great love with grateful love and reparation for all the outrages committed against him in the Blessed Sacrament.‚Äù Mother Mary Paschal explains that the sodality‚Äôs adorers join themselves to the unceasing intercession of the Son, worshipping with all the angels, saints and friends of God. She asks, ‚ÄúWho can imagine what God will accomplish for the salvation of the world through the prayers of the faithful?‚Äù Franciscan Friars Support Sodality The Franciscan Missionaries of the Eternal Word assist the Poor Clares at the shrine by providing spiritual support: offering Mass and confession, leading healing services, Exposition of the Most Blessed Sacrament, Benediction, and sharing ‚ÄúSodality Day‚Äù talks with participants. In addition, this religious order of men, also founded by Mother Angelica, help spread the Gospel through EWTN‚Äôs global media network. ‚ÄúAdoration is something close to our hearts, as we as a community spend much time in prayer in front of the Blessed Sacrament. As Franciscan friars, this is part of our charism, emulating St. Francis‚Äô reverence and devotion to the Holy Eucharist,‚Äù explained Father Leonard Mary, the community‚Äôs superior. ‚ÄúWe have a great love of the Blessed Sacrament.‚Äù Through participation in the Adoration Sodality, he prays that more people will develop a greater love for adoration and a greater desire to spend time in front of the Blessed Sacrament in adoration. ‚ÄúThat they too, in the love they gain, or the love they receive from Jesus, will communicate this love with others,‚Äù he added. Father Miguel Marie currently serves as the director of liturgy and sacristy at the shrine, offering the sacraments to the Poor Clares and to those who visit the shrine. He assists on Adoration Sodality Days and has given a talk to participants. ‚ÄúMy hope is that the members would respond to God‚Äôs grace more generously so that all may be more and more Christlike in their living out their faith, hope and love,‚Äù he said, ‚Äúand, also, that they would share with others their own experience or personally invite others to come with them so that there shall be more adorers of Our Lord in the Eucharist.‚Äù Adoring the Lord as a Family The Preiss family ‚Äî John and Teresa and their 10 children ‚Äî have lived near the shrine for the past 16 years. They participate in shrine events, with several of their sons serving the altar at Mass, assisting the friars. They make it a priority to attend the Adoration Sodality Day each month as a family. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really been a blessing for our family to be part of something so beautiful,‚Äù explained John, who is president of Fatima Family Apostolate International . ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to miss it. To experience the Sodality Day, to meet new people from all over the world and local people too, it‚Äôs created a better bond. We take off work and treat it as a family retreat day.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt [the Sodality] really feels like a family now,‚Äù Teresa added. ‚ÄúWe spend almost the whole day at the shrine, and you really get to know people.‚Äù ‚ÄúAdoration is important because you can reflect on what is going on in your life. This is our way of giving everything to God,‚Äù John explained. ‚ÄúYou [take] your problems, things you‚Äôre worried about, and give it to him. It‚Äôs a relief to be able to be in adoration and participate in the Sodality.‚Äù Silvia Quinones and her young-adult daughters, Paola and Sophia, are also regular Adoration Sodality Day attendees. Their family has lived near the shrine for the past 15 years. ‚ÄúThe talks are very inspiring. We all have an obligation to strengthen our faith, so that is the main reason we make regular Holy Hours and participate in the Sodality,‚Äù Silvia said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very inspiring to me as a young person to participate,‚Äù Paola explained. ‚ÄúI love it. I really enjoy just being in front of Our Lord and making a Holy Hour.‚Äù Sophia added, ‚ÄúIt encourages me to deepen my faith more. The talks encourage me to take my faith more seriously. I feel the Presence of God in adoration.‚Äù Catholic convert John Stam is a lector at the shrine. He and his wife of 38 years, Deborah, bought a home in the area seven years ago near her brother, the late Father Charles McCabe of the Diocese of Mobile, Alabama. ‚ÄúWe were drawn to the shrine. The Sodality has been great because it builds our relationship with the Lord, and the people who come are encouraging and help you want to do better,‚Äù John said. The couple makes it a point to make at least one Holy Hour each week at a local parish and attend the Adoration Sodality Day each month. ‚ÄúAdoration and the Sodality is a priority. It feeds us. The more you get to know the Lord, he draws you,‚Äù Deborah explained. ‚ÄúI hope couples will find that adoration is an essential part of their relationship.‚Äù National Eucharistic Pilgrims As Providence would have it, pilgrims on the National Eucharistic Pilgrimage‚Äôs St. Juan Diego Route will be at the shrine during the next Adoration Sodality Day, June 20. Father John Eckert of the Diocese of Charlotte, North Carolina, will serve as presenter. ‚ÄúI am blessed that I get to be there during that time,‚Äù Father Eckert told the Register. He plans to speak on God‚Äôs omnipresence. ‚ÄúOur Lord is present 24/7. He‚Äôs there all the time. The sisters [at the shrine] remind us of that fact, that by giving their whole life to Eucharistic adoration, they are there with Our Lord all the time.‚Äù Father Eckert asserted, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs easy to forget about the sun in the sky. It‚Äôs easy to forget about the Son in the Tabernacle ‚Äî yet he is still there, wanting to heal us and bring us into his everlasting peace that is greater than anything.‚Äù The Poor Clares of Perpetual Adoration hope that the Adoration Sodality reminds many Christians that the Lord longs to be with us. ‚ÄúWhy else would he have done something so unthinkable as to remain silently in our midst in the Holy Eucharist?‚Äù Mother Mary Paschal asked. She concluded: ‚ÄúIn these difficult times, we all need a refuge, a source of strength that is greater than our own and that ‚Äòpeace that the world cannot give.‚Äô Those who make time for a Holy Hour, week after week, day after day, will find that the more we give ourselves to him, the more he gives himself to us.‚Äù Learn More Join the Adoration Sodality at IAdoreThee.com .

author: MetroNews Staff
title: 3 Guys Before The Game - Kansas State Preview (Episode 610)
text:
It‚Äôs been a memorable week for the No. 23 West Virginia basketball team. The Mountaineers recorded a memory-searing victory over No. 2 Iowa State on Jerry West Day, and then suffered a suprising loss at home to Arizona State.
On Saturday they‚Äôll have an opportunity to return to their winning ways at Kansas State. The Wildcats have struggled in the Big 12 but have the talent to be dangerous.
In this episode, the ‚ÄúGuys‚Äù recap the loss to Arizona State and preview the matchup with Kansas State.
Listener questions and texts complete the show.
3 Guys Before The Game is sponsored by ‚Äì Komax Business Systems , GoMart , Lou Wendell Marine Sales, Tudor‚Äôs Biscuit World and Conley CPA Group .
Don‚Äôt forget to check out the 3 Guys website .
Never miss an episode, it‚Äôs free, subscribe below.

author: Reuters
title: Putin est√° analizando las interrupciones de youtube en rusia, seg√∫n el kremlin - LA NACION
text:
MOSC√ö, 15 nov (Reuters) - El presidente Vladimir Putin est√° estudiando la lentitud y las interrupciones de YouTube en Rusia despu√©s de que el m√°ximo responsable del cine del pa√≠s le planteara el asunto, seg√∫n inform√≥ el Kremlin el viernes. Los cr√≠ticos creen que las autoridades est√°n perturbando de forma deliberada YouTube para impedir que los rusos vean una gran cantidad de contenidos cr√≠ticos con Putin y su gobierno. Rusia lo niega, alegando que los problemas se deben a que Google no ha actualizado sus equipos, una acusaci√≥n rebatida por la empresa y expertos en tecnolog√≠a.
Los servicios rusos de control de Internet han informado de cortes masivos en los √∫ltimos meses del servicio de alojamiento de videos en l√≠nea, propiedad de Google, de Alphabet, pero el regulador de las comunicaciones Roskomnadzor dijo el viernes que no ha registrado cambios en la calidad del servicio.
El portavoz del Kremlin, Dmitry Peskov, dijo que el problema de la velocidad est√° relacionado con el incumplimiento de la legislaci√≥n rusa por parte de Google y que las cuestiones t√©cnicas deb√≠an dirigirse a Roskomnadzor. Google no respondi√≥ de inmediato a las peticiones de comentarios.
Seg√∫n la empresa de investigaci√≥n Mediascope, m√°s de 50 millones de rusos utilizan YouTube a diario. Constituye una importante plataforma para la oposici√≥n rusa en el exilio y para los medios de comunicaci√≥n independientes.
Peskov afirm√≥ que la velocidad de YouTube no es una de las prioridades de la poblaci√≥n rusa, pero Karen Shakhnazarov, que ha dirigido el gigante estatal del cine sovi√©tico y ruso Mosfilm durante m√°s de 25 a√±os, dijo el jueves que se reuni√≥ con Putin y abord√≥ el asunto con √©l.
"Frenar YouTube, en mi opini√≥n, no es muy aconsejable hoy en d√≠a", dijo Shakhnazarov en la televisi√≥n estatal. "El presidente respondi√≥ que hay todo tipo de asquerosidades all√≠".
Shakhnazarov dijo estar de acuerdo en que hay algunos contenidos malos en YouTube, pero afirm√≥ que quienes quieren acceder a ellas son capaces de sortear las restricciones y muchos otros s√≥lo quieren ver pel√≠culas y otros contenidos. "Me escuch√≥ y me dijo: 'Lo estudiar√©'", asegur√≥.
(Reporte de Dmitry Antonov, Alexander Marrow y Gleb Stolyarov; editado en espa√±ol por Carlos Serrano)
Reuters Conforme a los criterios de Conoc√© m√°s

author: B√°rbara Paillal
title: Senador Huenchumilla (DC) e inhabilidades en Ley de Notarios: ‚Äú¬øPor qu√© a los hijos los vas a castigar por lo que hacen sus padres?‚Äù ¬´ Diario y Radio Universidad Chile
text:
Escritorio MEN√ö Temas Noticias Pol√≠tica Economia Cultura Internacional Deportes Reportajes Opinion L√≠nea Editorial Radio Se√±al en vivo FM Programaci√≥n Vuelve a escuchar 5835129127 207522067f Justicia Nacional Senador Huenchumilla (DC) e inhabilidades en Ley de Notarios: ‚Äú¬øPor qu√© a los hijos los vas a castigar por lo que hacen sus padres?‚Äù El parlamentario descart√≥ un conflicto de inter√©s luego de que pidiera revisar la prohibici√≥n para que familiares de legisladores opten a cargos de notarios, dado el trabajo de su esposa: "Esta ley no le afecta en nada".
B√°rbara Paillal
 Jueves 8 de agosto 2024 16:44 hrs. Senador Francisco Huenchumilla Foto: ATON.
